title: Sequence-function space of radical SAM cyclophane synthases reveal conserved active site residues that influence substrate specificity
content:
RSC Chem. Biol., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4CB00227J, Communication
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Chin-Soon Phan, Brandon I. Morinaka
The uncharacterized rSAM enzyme HtkB from Pandoraea sp. catalyzes a HisC2-to-LysCβ crosslink. ColabFold and mutagenesis was used to reveal residues D214 in HtkB and H204 in HaaB are important for substrate specificity.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
